NoMATLABver: No MATLAB Version could be determined

MATLAB was detected on this system, but its location is unconventional
and the version number could not be detected
NoMATLAB:
No path to the MATLAB root directory could be located on this device.
If MATLAB is installed on this device and this message is displaying,
please contact your system administration and check whether MATLAB is
listed in your system's PATH variable.
JsonImproperFormat: Json sidecars not in proper json format

ExploreASL GUI has detected that the json sidecars present for this dataset
are not in appropriate format. The following inconsistency was found:
NoJsonSidecars: No Json sidecards could be detected

You have indicated 'Overwrite keys in BIDS sidecars?' as True, implying that this is a BIDS imported dataset. However, no ASL json sidecars could be detected. Please ensure your dataset has been imported properly by the Importer Module into a BIDS format.

Proceeding with the rest of the DataPar file creation.
BIDSoverwriteforNonBIDS: Indicated BIDS overwrite for non-BIDS dataset

Please ensure your dataset has been imported properly by the Importer Module into a BIDS format if you have 'Overwrite keys in BIDS sidecars?' checked.

Proceeding with the rest of the DataPar file creation.
ImpossibleM0: An impossible M0 setting was encountered

The user has indicated that 'M0 exists as a separate scan' but no _m0scan.json
could be found for the following:
InvalidExploreASLDir: The path you specified is not an ExploreASL directory.
InvalidDirectory: The path you have selected is not a valid directory.
InvalidFSLDirectory: The path you have selected is not a valid FSL bin directory
InvalidStudyDirectory: The path you have selected for your study directory is not a valid study path
FileNoteFound: The indicated filepath could not be found:
IncorrectFile:
The file selected was either of the wrong filetype than what is required
or it did not exist
BadParFile:
ExploreASL GUI has detected that the json you have loaded from is not a
properly-formatted json. The following inconsistency was found:
ImpossibleDirDepth: The directory depth you have indicated does not have directories present at that level
ImportCritError:
The import module could not generate the analysis directory.
This usually occurs if the user has specified an incorrect directory structure.
Perhaps a DUMMY directory was forgotten?
IncompatibleMATLAB: Incompatible MATLAB version on your machine
Running ExploreASL requires a MATLAB version of 2019a or later
NoDataPar: The required DataPar.json file could not be located for this directory. Exiting.
BadDataParFile: Data Par File has bad formatting

One or more keys could not be read from the DataPar.json file.
Please ensure the DataPar.json was not altered incorrectly by the user.
The specific error detected was:
BadDataParFileJson: Data Par File has incorrect JSON syntax

The DataPar.json file has an incorrect json syntax.
Please fix before attempting a re-run.
The specific error detected is as follows:
NoWorkloadDetected:
The number of anticipated .status files was zero.
If you are wanting to perform a re-run, use the Process Modifier subsection
of this window to indicate which operations you'd like to re-run.
ParticipantsTSVNotFound: participants.tsv was not located in this directory

The participants.tsv file could not be located in the directory you provided.
This file is usually made during the Population module.
Please ensure you have run the Population module for the study you wish to assess
LockDirSystemNotFound:
The study you provided does not have a lock directory system in play.
This would be automatically created if a study was run. Please run your
study first before trying to modify it for a re-run.
SubjectsNotFound: The subjects listed were not found
The list of subjects whose json files you which to manipulate were not found in the current study
UnsuccessfulExploreASLrun: Errors were encountered during ExploreASL run
The following study directories encountered at least 1 error during their run:

Please review the generated [Date of run] ExploreASL run - errors.txt
within each of the listed studies to see which subjects could not be processed
NoStartExploreASL: An error was encountered while preparing study:

Please check for each of the following:
	1) The filepath to the study exists
	2) The filepath to the study matches the one provided to the Task Scheduler
	3) That the ExploreASL filepath specified within the parms file exists
	4) That the subjects within the study are the same as when the DataPar.json file was defined
BadStudyDir:
The filepath you have specfied either does not exist, is not a directory,
or is a study that did not have its Population Module run
BadMetaDataFile:
The filepath you have specified either does not exist, is not a file,
or has an incorrect extension. Supported file types include:
- Comma-separated values (.csv)
- Tab-separated values (.tsv)
- Excel spreadsheets (.xlsx)
ImpossibleDtype:
You are trying to convert a column with word categories into a numerical.
This is not permitted. Reverting back to categorical.
MRIPlotNoDataPar: Unable to load Plot & MRI Viewer

No DataPar.json parameters file was located in the analysis directory.
This is required by MRI Viewer to be able to select subjects
MRIPlotBadDataPar: Unable to load Plot & MRI Viewer
The DataPar.json parameter file was located, but there is a syntax error and some keys could not be accessed
MRIPlotNoT1: An error occurred while trying to fetch the T1 data for subject
MRIPlotNoCBF: An error occurred while trying to fetch the qCBF data for subject
MRIPlotDiscrep: An error occurred while trying to fetch image data for subject_run

It is possible that the images exist in the Population directory, but the
program could not fetch them due to a possible discrepancy between the
Population folder and the rest of the study folder.
